CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 31, 1955, pg. 3, reads: "Double-Death House - Eighteen-year-old Carole Smith died in doorway (marked x) where, according to Benjamin Fleming who jumped from the second-story window of the bedroom where his wife was dying, in an attempt to halt the stabbing of Carole by the killer, identified by police as William Henderson. Fleming injured his left shoulder and elbow in the fall to the cobblestone alley. - Harris Photo."  Portions of accompanying article read: "Jealous Suitor Confesses Fatally Stabbing Girl and Her Mother - Tries to Make Police Shoot Him at Arrest - Thirty-two year old William (Short Arm Willie) Henderson of 2311 Humber Way, on Wednesday morning, meekly confessed guilt to Pittsburgh's most vicious 1955 crime - the double killing of a Humber Street mother and daughter early Tuesday morning.  The city's homicide department quizzed Henderson, who in a formal signed statement admitted using a hunting knife to hack to death Mrs. Rosemary Smith and her 18-year-old daughter, Carole, of 2237 Humber Way, and slash Mrs. Smith's common-law husband, Benjamin Fleming.  According to the office of Homicide Capt. Joseph T. Flynn, Henderson said an argument over money and a neglected meal for him preceded the slashings.  Henderson and one of the victims, Carole Smith, mother of two children, had been dating each other.  Fleming told the Courier Tuesday afternoon that the affair however, was not 'serious.' ... The day before Henderson confessed to the killings and said that an argument preceded the double killing, Fleming said he heard no argument by instead was awakened by his wife's screams. 'I was sleeping in the rear room and heard my wife screaming 'Come here,' Fleming told a Courier reporter.  'I met her near the door of her daughter's room and she fell into my arms. The fellow was dragging Carole across the floor and towards the steps.'  Fleming said he was able to place his wife on the bed, but in the meantime Henderson slammed the bedroom door and proceeded to drag Carole downstairs.  'As he slammed the door he slashed me across the left cheek and left hand,' Fleming said.  Slashed Man Leaps Two Stories.  Hoping to be able to defend Carole, Fleming jumped from the second story window to the cobblestone street, but Henderson had fled, leaving the young woman dying at the bottom of the steps.  According to Homicide Squad, Henderson stabbed both victims in almost identical points of the bodies.  The wounds were above the heart and on the left arm  Three children are without their mothers as the result of the tragedy.  Three Children Made Orphans.  Juvenile court authorities are in charge of the 8-month-old daughter of Mrs. Smith and the 4-year-old girl, and 1-year-old boy of Carole Smith..."
TitMainTitle: Two story clapboard house, site of murder of Rosemary and Carole Smith, 2237 Humber Way, Hill District
